content: @Laryn I made a PR for Entity Plus to make it work with the new entity caching.
Thanks! I'll take a look.
@Joseph Flatt ++
flatt** leveled up! (Karma: 2)

Running into this error whenever I run updates with the latest version:
Notice: Undefined property: RulesEntityController::$cache in EntityPlusController->load() (line 222 of /home/sensual/public_html/modules/entity_plus/includes/entity_plus.controller.inc).
Notice: Undefined property: RulesEntityController::$cache in EntityPlusController->load() (line 291 of /home/sensual/public_html/modules/entity_plus/includes/entity_plus.controller.inc).
Notice: Undefined property: RulesEntityController::$cache in EntityPlusControllerExportable->load() (line 747 of /home/sensual/public_html/modules/entity_plus/includes/entity_plus.controller.inc).
Notice: Undefined property: RulesEntityController::$cache in EntityPlusController->load() (line 222 of /home/sensual/public_html/modules/entity_plus/includes/entity_plus.controller.inc).
Notice: Undefined property: RulesEntityController::$cache in EntityPlusController->load() (line 291 of /home/sensual/public_html/modules/entity_plus/i

Any idea of how to resolve?
The site is on the latest version (that's when the issue started)

Elisabeth
@Elisabeth Garbeil I created a new version of the Entity Plus module this morning that should fix that message.
@Joseph Flatt It does not show as needing update - do I need to install the dev version? And is it safe? This is a live production site.
Which version do you currently have?

Joseph Flatt said:

Which version do you currently have?

1x-1.0.5
Elisabeth
Maybe it takes a while to show up in the updater. I am not really sure how that works.
At some point 1.x-1.0.6 should show up.
I think if you click teh CHECK MANUALLY button it should grab the latest

drush is picking up on 1.0.6:

(1.x) └─ ∴ lando drush dl entity_plus --select
    Choose one of the available releases for entity_plus

         [0]    :    1.x-1.0.6
         [1]    :    1.x-1.0.5
         [2]    :    1.x-1.0.4
         [3]    :    1.x-1.0.3
         [4]    :    1.x-1.0.2
         [5]    :    1.x-1.0.1
@Joseph Flatt I will check daily.

It was showing up for me in the UI, too:
Screen-Shot-2020-06-05-at-10.36.22-AM.jpg
I think @Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) is right, you may just need to run cron or "Check updates manually" if you want it now, otherwise it will appear next time your cron runs, most likely.
@Laryn I think i can run cron. If that will update the list, I'll do it. I can also check updates manually after.

@Joseph Flatt - still happening as of today:
Also still getting this error:
Notice: Undefined property: RulesEntityController::$cache in EntityPlusControllerExportable->load() (line 772 of /modules/entity_plus/includes/entity_plus.controller.inc).

WebServer Apache
CentOS
Backdrop 1.16.1
Entity Plus
PHP 7.0.33
MySQL, MariaDB, or equivalent version 5.5.5-10.0.38-MariaDB

thank you,
Elisabeth

I updated the issue queue.

@Joseph Flatt I'm not sure if you use Paragraphs at all, but do you think this could relate to Entity Plus somehow?
https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/paragraphs/issues/65

Images uploaded into Paragraph WYSIWYG text field disappear · Issue #65 · backdrop-contrib/paragraphs
Reported to me from two different sites now, and sounds very similar to #14 but that fix is still included and it was working fine until recently, so it must be something different. Images uploaded...

@Laryn I don't use Paragraphs very much. If I had to guess, I would suspect that there are missing calls to file_save(), or that the file is getting saved before the entity for some reason and is causing the file to be temporary.
Thanks. The trick is that this is a regression so I'm not sure where/how it was introduced.
But I appreciate that input and will keep digging!

Hi Everyone...,

Just playing with porting the nodeownership module and it uses Entity....

In the Entity Plus readme is says "This module also renames several functions from the entity_xxx() format to entity_plus_xxx() format to prevent conflict"

Q: is there a list of the renamed functions ?

Thanks in advance.

Steve

I'm not sure if there's a comprehensive list of which functions went into core (with the same name) and which are now in Entity Plus (with new names, e.g. instead of entity_NAME() the function would be entity_plus_NAME()) You may need to search core and/or the Entity Plus codebase to be sure.
This might be a good page for the Entity Plus wiki.
I'll compile a list and submit it... erm... how do I submit it :smile:

@Steve Moorhouse please open an issue at https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/new/choose about it, and tag it as "Documentation task". Thank in advance :pray:

Build software better, together
